programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Aileen Wuornos sold her body to survive; this generated a deep-seeded rage for those who would pay for her services which allegedly resulted in the deaths of seven Florida men.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: When ex-con Scott Nelson looked at middle-aged nanny Jennifer Fulford he allegedly saw a target for his rage; Nelson had other plans when he entered the courtroom for his trial.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: William Coday fell in love with Columbian immigrant Gloria Gomez; when he lived in Germany, he'd thought he had a similar love; Gloria Gomez's life would come to a similarly brutal end.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Betty Broderick was a socialite who led a perfect life with a successful husband and kids until it all came crashing down in divorce, and murder.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Jurors hear from the undercover cop who pretended to be a hit man in the case against Dalia Dippolito; she was accused of trying to hire him to end her husband Michael's life after just six months of marriage.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Prosecutors said that at first Dalia Dippolito offered only $1,200 to have her husband, Michael, killed. The undercover cop who played the fake hitman told her that amount wasn't even enough to buy the gun to kill him.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The lead detective on the Dalia Dippolito case took the stand in her trial. Alex Moreno was assigned the case on his day off. That's after Dalia's friend told the Boynton Beach Police Department, she wanted to hire a hit man to kill her husband.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: "It's not about the money," that's what Dalia Dippolito told her friend about allegedly wanting to have her husband, Michael, killed; she didn't know it, but that friend was working with police who wanted to catch her in this solicitation.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Police tell Dalia Dippolito's friend that he won't be arrested over her alleged murder-for-hire plot to kill her husband, Michael; instead, they got him to be a confidential informant to get her on tape talking to someone posing as a hit man.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The defense tried to challenge Michael Dippolito by questioning his credibility; Dalia's attorney focused on his criminal past of fraud and scams.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The undercover officer posing as a hit man warns Dalia Dippolito that once the murder of her husband Michael is carried out, she would not have a chance to change her mind, but she told the officer: "I am 5,000% sure."

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Prosecutors claim Dalia Dippolito had two affairs while married to Michael; one lover allegedly helped her steal money from her husband and tried to get Michael to violate his probation so he'd go back to prison.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: A domestic dispute involving Kit Martin's then-wife made its way to trial; before the deaths of his three neighbors, the defendant went through a bitter divorce; his ex-wife was accused of threatening to ruin his career and life.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Re-Examining The Gun Used To Kill
programme.desc: A crime scene reconstructionist has more to tell the jury; this is during the defense case where Kit's attorneys are trying to show that he isn't responsible for the deaths of his three neighbors; the state says the bullets are linked to Kit's guns.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The crime scene reconstruction expert testifying for Kit Martin's defence wraps up his testimony; the defendant takes the stand to tell the jury his side of the story; Kit Martin tries to convince them that the prosecution has it all wrong.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The defense says it seemed like a golden life until he married Joan Harmon; the jury hears details about the defendant's background, including the drama surrounding his ex-wife and their divorce.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The military accuses Kit Martin of mishandling classified information and child abuse before his murder trial; Kit tells the jury that he is innocent of those charges as well as in the shootings of his three neighbors; Kit blames his ex-wife.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Kit Martin tells the jury that he is innocent in the shooting deaths of his three neighbors; and he claims he has no idea where all the accusations linking him to the crimes are coming from.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Questions for the Albert Family Patriarch
programme.desc: Karen Read's lead attorney drills Brian Albert on the stand during cross-examination; the Defense contends that John O'Keefe was beaten up inside the Albert family home and then dumped in the front lawn in the freezing cold during a blizzard.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Selling the House and Rehoming the Family Dog
programme.desc: Brian Albert, a retired 30-year veteran on the Boston police force, is central to the Defense's thirty-party killer theory; Karen Read's attorneys want to show the jury that it is no coincidence that John O'Keefe was found on Albert's front lawn.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The long cross-examination continues on the patriarch of the influential Canton family; Brian Albert worked in the Boston police force for three decades before he retired; John O'Keefe was a 16-year veteran in the same Boston Police Department.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Brian Albert tells jurors that a fellow officer in his department, John O'Keefe, was found unconscious on his front lawn, and he never came out to assist or look into what happened; Karen Read's lead attorney doesn't let Albert off the hook.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors continue to bring in more family members of the Alberts; the son of Brian and Nicole Albert takes the stand; he was outside the Albert family home where John O'Keefe, a veteran of the Boston PD, was found unresponsive in the front yard.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Birthday Party Leads to a Fatality
programme.desc: Karen Read's defense has more questions for one of the children in the influential Albert family; the Defense contends that it is this family with ties in the local government and police department that is behind the cover up of John O'Keefe's death.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: No one knows why actress Lana Clarkson decided to go to music producer Phil Spector's home for a nightcap, but they do know that by the end of the night she was dead; Spector claims she committed suicide, but the evidence says otherwise.
